words.definition: To admire someone is to like them for what they do.
words.example: I admire my brother for his hard work.

words.definition: To aid someone is to help them when they need something.
words.example: The doctor aided the boy after his accident.

words.definition: To attempt something is to try to do that thing.
words.example: I am attempting to learn English.

words.definition: Authority is the power that someone has because of their position.
words.example: The policeman has authority on the streets.

words.definition: A capital is an important city where a country’s leaders live and work.
words.example: We will visit the capital to learn about our government.

words.definition: To cooperate is to work together to do something.
words.example: The students cooperated to clean up the classroom.

words.definition: To defend someone or something is to protect them from attack.
words.example: The soldiers defended the town from the invaders.

words.definition: Destruction is damage to something so bad that it can’t be fixed.
words.example: After the big fire, there was much destruction in the city.

words.definition: Disorder is a lack of order, or a complete mess.
words.example: The classroom was in a state of disorder.

words.definition: A division is the act of separating something into different parts.
words.example: The division of the money was fair.

words.definition: To enable someone is to make it possible for them to do something.
words.example: The new law enabled people to get more help.

words.definition: To frustrate someone is to prevent them from doing something or making them feel annoyed.
words.example: The broken car frustrated his travel plans.

words.definition: To govern is to control the way a country or city is run.
words.example: The king governs the country.

words.definition: If you have plenty of something, you have more than enough.
words.example: We have plenty of food for everyone.

words.definition: To relieve something bad means to make it less bad.
words.example: The medicine relieved his headache.

words.definition: Reputation is the opinion that people have about someone.
words.example: He has a reputation for being a very hard worker.

words.definition: If something is royal, it belongs to or is connected with a king or queen.
words.example: The royal family lives in the palace.

words.definition: A slave is a person who is owned by another person and forced to work for no money.
words.example: Many years ago, there were many slaves.

words.definition: To struggle is to try very hard to do something difficult.
words.example: He struggled to carry the heavy box.

words.definition: If someone is stupid, they are not smart.
words.example: It was a stupid mistake.
